person.persName: James Simpson Bush, Jr. (Montgomery County, Kentucky, saddler and harness maker)

body.p: Montgomery County, Kentucky, saddler and harness maker. Kentucky native. Son of James S. Bush, Sr. and Mary Jane Adams Bush. Harness maker in Montgomery County, Kentucky, in 1860. Harness maker in Clark County in 1863. Enlisted in Captain W.R. Marshall's Company Artillery (C.S.A.) as a private on October 15, 1862. Reported as deserted in Knoxville, Tennessee, on May 1, 1863. Reported to Headquarters of the Military District of Western Kentucky in Louisville, Kentucky, on June 5, 1863. Prisoner of war at Camp Chase in Columbus, Ohio, from June 5, 1863, to June 13, 1863. Signed a loyalty oath to the United States on June 13, 1863.
